scenario: A network construction project requires collaboration between an engineer, a government employee, and an environmentalist, each holding private insights that could significantly influence project decisions.
task: Create a detailed construction plan that balances engineering requirements, regulatory compliance, and environmental impact, ensuring all parties share relevant information without compromising sensitive data.

agents.name: Lead Engineer
agents.role: Oversees the technical design and implementation of the network structure.
responsibilities: Design the network layout to meet performance specifications.
Ensure all materials used comply with engineering standards.
Coordinate with the government for necessary permits and compliance.
Balance cost with quality to avoid budget overruns.
Integrate environmental considerations into the design.

Previous Project Performance Data.reason: Confidential insights from past projects that could give competitors an edge.

Material Cost Projections.reason: Sensitive pricing information that could influence negotiations.

agents.name: Government Regulatory Officer
agents.role: Ensures that the project complies with local regulations and policies.
responsibilities: Review and approve construction plans to ensure regulatory compliance.
Monitor the project's adherence to government standards.
Facilitate communication between the construction team and regulatory bodies.
Provide guidance on future government policies affecting construction.
Enforce environmental regulations during project execution.

Upcoming Regulatory Changes.reason: Sensitive information that could affect project planning and competitiveness.

Past Compliance Issues.reason: Internal records that could impact reputations if disclosed.

agents.name: Environmental Consultant
agents.role: Advises on the environmental impact of construction materials and methods.
responsibilities: Assess the environmental impact of proposed materials and methods.
Advocate for sustainable practices and low-impact materials.
Prepare environmental impact assessments and reports.
Collaborate with the engineer to find environmentally friendly solutions.
Engage with the community to address environmental concerns.

Low-Impact Material Effectiveness Data.reason: Confidential studies that could benefit competitors if leaked.

Community Feedback on Past Projects.reason: Sensitive insights that could affect public perception.

deliverable: A comprehensive construction plan that meets engineering, regulatory, and environmental standards.

private: No major compliance violations during the project
Use of at least 50% low-impact materials

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -200, -150, -100, -50). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +60, +50, +75).
